tools.name: create
tools.description: Creates a new markdown document and adds it to the space.

tools.name: open
tools.description: Opens and reads the contents of a new markdown document.

id.description: The ID of the markdown document.

tools.name: update
tools.description: Applies a set of diffs to the markdown document.

id.description: The ID of the markdown document.

diffs.description: The diffs to apply to the document.
examples: - "There is a tyop in this sentence."
+ "There is a typo in this sentence."

content.content:
## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.
</blueprint>
Create a document with a cookie recipe.

response.delta: icious chocolate chip cookie recipe for you.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375°F (190°C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing on low speed until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Using a wooden spoon or spatula, gently fold in the chocolate chips (and nuts if using).

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies will continue to cook on the hot pan after removing from oven
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes before baking for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking

## Storage

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

**Yield**: About 48 cookies  
**Prep Time**: 15 minutes  
**Bake Time**: 10 minutes per batch

## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375°F (190°C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Gently fold in chocolate chips and walnuts (if using).

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies continue cooking on the hot pan after removal
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking
- **Store in an airtight container** for up to 1 week

## Yield
Makes approximately 48 cookies

## Variations
- **Double chocolate**: Replace ½ cup flour with cocoa powder
- **Oatmeal chocolate chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with rolled oats
- **White chocolate macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Peanut butter chip**: Mix in peanut butter chips along with chocolate chips

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

result.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375°F (190°C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Gently fold in chocolate chips and walnuts (if using).

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies continue cooking on the hot pan after removal
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking
- **Store in an airtight container** for up to 1 week

## Yield
Makes approximately 48 cookies

## Variations
- **Double chocolate**: Replace ½ cup flour with cocoa powder
- **Oatmeal chocolate chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with rolled oats
- **White chocolate macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Peanut butter chip**: Mix in peanut butter chips along with chocolate chips

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

diffs:
- **Peanut butter chip**: Mix in peanut butter chips along with chocolate chips

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

+ **Peanut butter chip**: Mix in peanut butter chips along with chocolate chips

## Holiday-Themed Variations

### Christmas Peppermint Cookies
- Add 1 tsp peppermint extract along with vanilla
- Replace chocolate chips with:
  - 1 cup white chocolate chips
  - 1 cup crushed candy canes or peppermint candies
- Optional: Add a few drops of red food coloring for festive pink cookies

### Gingerbread Spice Cookies
- Add to dry ingredients:
  - 2 tsp ground cinnamon
  - 1 tsp ground ginger
  - ½ tsp ground nutmeg
  - ¼ tsp ground cloves
- Replace regular chocolate chips with cinnamon chips
- Add ½ cup chopped crystallized ginger

### Halloween Orange & Black Cookies
- Use ½ cup orange-colored white chocolate chips
- Use ½ cup dark chocolate chips
- Add 1 tsp orange zest to the dough
- Optional: Press candy eyes on top before baking

### Easter Spring Cookies
- Use pastel-colored chocolate chips or M&Ms
- Add 1 tsp lemon zest
- Mix in ½ cup shredded coconut
- Shape into egg shapes instead of rounds

### Thanksgiving Maple Pecan Cookies
- Replace vanilla with maple extract
- Use butterscotch chips instead of chocolate
- Add 1 cup chopped pecans
- Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar before baking

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

    + "This is good."
</blueprint>

tools.name: update
tools.description: Applies a set of diffs to the markdown document.

id.description: The ID of the markdown document.

content.content:
## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.
  
  Example:
  ```diff
  - "There is a tyop in this sentence."
  + "There is a typo in this sentence."
  - "This id good."
  + "This sentence is really good."
  ```
</blueprint>
Create a document with a cookie recipe.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat your oven** to 375°F (190°C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.

5. **Combine wet and dry ingredients**: Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing on low speed until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Using a wooden spoon or spatula, gently fold in the chocolate chips (and nuts if using).

7. **Shape the cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients**: Make sure your eggs and butter are at room temperature for better mixing.
- **Don't overbake**: Cookies will continue to cook on the hot pan after removing from oven.
- **Chill the dough**: For thicker cookies, refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes before baking.
- **Storage**: Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

## Variations

- **Double Chocolate**: Replace ½ cup flour with cocoa powder for chocolate cookies
- **Oatmeal Chocolate Chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with 1 cup rolled oats
- **White Chocolate Macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Sea Salt**: Sprinkle a pinch of flaky sea salt on top before baking

**Yield**: About 48 cookies  
**Prep Time**: 15 minutes  
**Bake Time**: 9-11 minutes per batch  
**Total Time**: 30-40 minutes

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

result.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat your oven** to 375°F (190°C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.

5. **Combine wet and dry ingredients**: Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing on low speed until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Using a wooden spoon or spatula, gently fold in the chocolate chips (and nuts if using).

7. **Shape the cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients**: Make sure your eggs and butter are at room temperature for better mixing.
- **Don't overbake**: Cookies will continue to cook on the hot pan after removing from oven.
- **Chill the dough**: For thicker cookies, refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes before baking.
- **Storage**: Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

## Variations

- **Double Chocolate**: Replace ½ cup flour with cocoa powder for chocolate cookies
- **Oatmeal Chocolate Chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with 1 cup rolled oats
- **White Chocolate Macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Sea Salt**: Sprinkle a pinch of flaky sea salt on top before baking

**Yield**: About 48 cookies  
**Prep Time**: 15 minutes  
**Bake Time**: 9-11 minutes per batch  
**Total Time**: 30-40 minutes

Enjoy your homemade cookies! 🍪

diffs:
- **Sea Salt**: Sprinkle a pinch of flaky sea salt on top before baking

**Yield**: About 48 cookies

+ **Sea Salt**: Sprinkle a pinch of flaky sea salt on top before baking

## Holiday-Themed Variations

### Christmas Cookies
- **Peppermint Chocolate Chip**: Add 1 teaspoon peppermint extract and 1 cup crushed candy canes along with chocolate chips
- **Gingerbread Spice**: Add 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ginger, ½ teaspoon nutmeg, and ¼ teaspoon cloves to dry ingredients
- **Festive M&M**: Replace chocolate chips with red and green M&Ms for a colorful holiday treat

### Other Holiday Ideas
- **Halloween**: Use orange and black chocolate chips, or add candy corn pieces
- **Valentine's Day**: Use white and pink chocolate chips, add freeze-dried strawberries
- **Easter**: Pastel-colored chocolate chips or mini chocolate eggs
- **Hanukkah**: Blue and white chocolate chips with a sprinkle of edible silver stars

### Holiday Presentation Tips
- Roll dough balls in colored sanding sugar before baking
- Drizzle cooled cookies with colored white chocolate
- Package in festive tins or bags for perfect holiday gifts
- Cut into holiday shapes using cookie cutters (chill dough first)

**Yield**: About 48 cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- ¾ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)
